paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information related to the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Asian population, age range not specified

individual_records.phenotype_details: congestive heart failure, conduction block, and intractable arrhythmia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Within the 23 patients, only five patients were observed to possess a low left ventricle ejection fraction (ejection fraction <50%).

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a significant increase in the rate of dissociation of TTR tetramers into monomers, promoting amyloidogenesis.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation is frequently associated with familial amyloid cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: Val122Ile is the frequently occurred mutation that causes FAC.
Patients with congestive heart failure, conduction block, and intractable arrhythmia need the implantation of pacemakers with/without cardioverter defibrillators.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is known to cause familial amyloid polyneuropathy, leading to various clinical manifestations.

variants.additional_notes: Cardiac manifestations are mainly manifested in different types of heart block.

functional_data.summary: The mutation can lead to late-onset restrictive cardiomyopathy as well as sensorimotor and autonomic polyneuropathy.

variants.additional_notes: Patients with Thr60Ala mutation can develop late-onset restrictive cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: Patients with Thr60Ala mutation can develop late-onset restrictive cardiomyopathy as well as sensorimotor and autonomic polyneuropathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants and penetrance data were extracted successfully.
